categories: Category:Articles with elements from unlicensed sources

nodes.text: The Drilbia system was located in the Outer Rim Territories' Brema sector.
It was also known as the Drilb system.
The Drilbia system was the origin point of beverage known as Drilbian wine.

The "Drilb system," in reference to the Drilbian wine beverage, was first mentioned in "Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star, How I Wonder Where We Are," a 1990 roleplaying game source article written by Glen Allison as a supplement for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game and published in Voyages SF 13. Since the article, which placed the star system in the Dartibek sector, was released outside of the Lucas Licensing process, its canonicity within the Star Wars Legends continuity was never confirmed.

The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas, authored by Daniel Wallace and Jason Fry, named the system "Drilbia" and placed it in grid square M-17, and the StarWars.com Online Companion to the book subsequently overrode the Voyages SF 13 placement by establishing that the Drilbia system was part of the Brema sector.
